2zmTtiyeZNvKPOcI.name: Ink Blood
2zmTtiyeZNvKPOcI.description:
Requirements Reginald's body is filled with toxic ink

Trigger An adjacent creature Strikes Reginald with a melee weapon or unarmed attack and deals damage

The creature is exposed to Reginald's poison ink.

3dd754R1VUxFyZiT.name: Secret of Rebirth
3dd754R1VUxFyZiT.description: If a creature with less than 5 Secret Knowledge points reduces Reginald to 0 HP (or dealt the last damage to him before he dies from using Overdrive Engine), Reginald's body dissipates into a puddle of ink and releases a black wave of psychic energy. Each creature within 30 feet is bathed in a torrent of forbidden secrets and gains 1 Secret Knowledge point. Reginald's body reforms [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} later in his sanctum at full health at a location of his choosing (typically the Pool of Secrets, area L11). This ability activates automatically with no action necessary on Vancaskerkin's behalf.

rlZ9VxWPwn9XfGgL.name: Breath Weapon
rlZ9VxWPwn9XfGgL.description: Reginald's lungs are equipped with ink canisters, allowing him to spew a @Template[type:line|distance:60] of ink that deals [[/r 9d6[poison]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:39|basic:true|traits:damaging-effects] save; on a failure, the creature is also subjected to Reginald's poison ink).

zaQRIy856WuUiHBw.name: Overdrive Engine
zaQRIy856WuUiHBw.description:
[free-action] (clockwork) Reginald is equipped with clockwork organs to power his body

Requirements Reginald has 175 Hit Points or fewer

Effect Reginald gains 200 temporary Hit Points, a +15-foot status bonus to Speed, and a +2 status bonus to melee attack rolls. His body begins to overheat, spewing steam that deals [[/r 9d6[fire]]] damage at the beginning of his turn to all creatures within 30 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save). After 2 rounds, Reginald explodes, dealing [[/r 19d6[fire]]] damage to all creatures within 60 feet (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save). Reginald dies. For the purposes of his Secret of Rebirth ability, the last creature to damage Reginald counts as killing him.

V3S7DLZ4aWxgcg1R.name: Poison Ink
V3S7DLZ4aWxgcg1R.description:
Reginald is immune to the toxic ink that flows through his veins

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 10 rounds

Stage 1 3d6 poison and sickened 1 (1 round)

Stage 2 4d6 poison sickened 2 (1 round).

KOfo0zVfgBhhWGjT.name: Quill Cannon
KOfo0zVfgBhhWGjT.description: Reginald is equipped with a cannon and hundreds of steel quills. He makes two steel quill attacks against every creature in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60], ignoring the multiple attack penalty until after all attacks are made. He can't use Quill Cannon again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

OF5xPm4it251t0zo.name: Reflective Plating
OF5xPm4it251t0zo.description: Reginald engages his defensive plating, which casts spell turning on him (counteract modifier +32).

5inXNyZGoLUMii53.name: Slither
5inXNyZGoLUMii53.description: With his body composed of ink and gears, Reginald can move through tight spaces as if he were a Tiny creature, treating them as difficult terrain.

UUw22Ccx1nqHZgFR.name: Unbalancing Blow
UUw22Ccx1nqHZgFR.description: Any creature a grick critically hits is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against its attacks until the end of the grick's next turn.

YXf0epw5INfNsVTi.name: Vermicular Movement
YXf0epw5INfNsVTi.description: When a grick takes a Stride action to move half its Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Vw3bmxYidV4ocAb1.name: Drain Wand
Vw3bmxYidV4ocAb1.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Scathka hasn't acted yet on their turn

Effect On their turn, Scathka casts one spell they've prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Scathka must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

eIDlmbUtMfTc108y.name: Throw Shadow Blade
eIDlmbUtMfTc108y.description:
Requirement Scathka is wielding a dagger

Effect Scathka draws a shadowy glyph on the dagger's blade and flings it at a nearby foe. Scathka makes a ranged Strike with the dagger with the range increment to 30 feet.

If the Strike hits, it deals [[/r 8d6[cold]]] damage (double damage on a critical success) and the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn (or [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

The dagger loses its shadowy magic as soon as the attack is resolved.

Exploding Statue.name: Agents of Edgewatch
Exploding Statue.description: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.
Exploding Statue.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire

R1OmPKgnrpEPWGr6.name: Attack of Opportunity
R1OmPKgnrpEPWGr6.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

OF6N85WER1HxJgCK.name: Integrated Launcher
OF6N85WER1HxJgCK.description: A projectile launcher is integrated into a clockwork assassin's systems, containing 10 spinning blades and five smoke bombs. When the assassin is destroyed, the launcher and its ammunition are also destroyed.

yOvz4I15CCPk78ns.name: Smoke Vision
yOvz4I15CCPk78ns.description: The clockwork assassin ignores the concealed condition from smoke.

q4WljID3qrZ5Fpnr.name: Wind-Up
q4WljID3qrZ5Fpnr.description: For the clockwork assassin to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. The assassin can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).A creature can attempt a @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the assassin down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the assassin is in standby mode.

mmdbAeOOVVjLALCx.name: Rapid Repair
mmdbAeOOVVjLALCx.description: The clockwork assassin spends 1 hour of its operational time to repair itself, regaining 25 Hit Points and refilling its integrated projectile launcher with 4 spinning blades (to a maximum of 10) and 2 smoke bombs (to a maximum of 5).

A7VgvFTQFpm1Cc79.name: Smoke Bomb Launcher
A7VgvFTQFpm1Cc79.description: The clockwork assassin launches a smoke bomb. A screen of thick, opaque smoke fills a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] within 60 feet of the clockwork assassin. Creatures within the area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

Y7P7UpMZajGcxNz4.name: Sneak Attack
Y7P7UpMZajGcxNz4.description: The clockwork assassin's Strikes deal an additional 3d6+4 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

GtoDWNmX34925xMc.name: Unbalancing Blow
GtoDWNmX34925xMc.description: Creatures hit by the clockwork assassin's rapier hand Strike are flat-footed until the start of the clockwork assassin's next turn.

5HdfiD2BmZU6LzvL.name: Whirlwind Strike
5HdfiD2BmZU6LzvL.description: The chopper makes a melee Strike against each enemy within melee reach. Its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

A8r84vdl4zcvpCMg.name: Free Blade
A8r84vdl4zcvpCMg.description:
Trigger The ghaele ends its turn while unable to act or attempts a greatsword Strike that would take a circumstance or status penalty.

Effect A ghaele's blade is implacable in the pursuit of freedom, and its energies can overpower any effect that would interfere with its swordplay.

The ghaele attempts to counteract each effect that prevents it from making a greatsword Strike, gives it a penalty to its greatsword Strike, or prevents it from acting.

The ghaele can use this ability even if it's otherwise unable to act.

nqhGLlFeLoFFBN9g.name: Light Form
nqhGLlFeLoFFBN9g.description:
A ghaele's body is partially corporeal and partially composed of light, with a color corresponding to the elemental energy currently residing in its blade (see Choose Weakness).

It can move through solid objects but can't end its action within a solid object.

Tfnx5jxpKaKtZ7ES.name: Choose Weakness
Tfnx5jxpKaKtZ7ES.description:
A ghaele attempts to Recall Knowledge about a foe they are facing.

If successful, they can change the elemental damage dealt by their greatsword and light ray to acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic, usually to match the foe's weakness.

They can also change their energy resistance to any of these energy types (this can be a different type than for their attacks).

The choices remain until they next use.

29elTy7XDcAju8yK.name: Ghaele's Gaze
29elTy7XDcAju8yK.description:
When a ghaele fixes their gaze upon a non-good creature, the creature is subjected to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.sX2o0HH4RjJDAZ8C]{Divine Decree} (@Check[type:will|dc:20|name:Divine Decree|traits:damaging-effect] save).

If it survives, the creature is temporarily immune to for 1 minute.

Gv8gIlACS3hfoYJF.name: Greater Holy Blade
Gv8gIlACS3hfoYJF.description: Any weapon becomes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.rvItjGQaYT7Luwtm]{+3} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.DH0kB9Wbr5pDeunX]{Holy} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} weapon while the ghaele wields it.

fvr1IlwjlQYM3Nr9.description:
Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

Hardness HP BT
3 12 6

3hoeSfakad2dxcKN.description:
Activate1 Interact

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.bcxVvIbuZWOvsKcA]{Effect: Darkvision Elixir (Moderate)}

7qqes4mzlHueunJX.name: Deep Breath
7qqes4mzlHueunJX.description: A Shikwashim mercenary can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

SGQATSbzafV9SYlH.name: Coordinated Distraction
SGQATSbzafV9SYlH.description:
With a sharp whistle or wave of their hand, the mercenary distracts an opponent so one of the mercenary's allies can land a clean blow.

The mercenary chooses a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet of the mercenary. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against the first Strike the mercenary's ally makes on its next turn; if the ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost.

Depending on how the mercenary distracts their foe, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

3N2FHMvzMRnvpsId.name: Human Hunter
3N2FHMvzMRnvpsId.description: A Shikwashim mercenary's multiple attack penalty for attacks against humans is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on their second attack per turn or -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on their third or subsequent attack per turn.

1qQjPJIus3hZOUXY.name: Powerful Swipe
1qQjPJIus3hZOUXY.description:
The Shikwashim mercenary makes a melee Strike. If it hits, it deals an extra die of damage.

This counts as two attacks for the mercenary's multiple attack penalty.

ISXykb5wK1DoaIOw.name: Terrain Advantage
ISXykb5wK1DoaIOw.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a Swim speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to a Shikwashim mercenary.

EKp5irpqgnTwEyjX.name: Backdrop
EKp5irpqgnTwEyjX.description: When a creature attempts to Strike a living mural and critically misses, the attacker hits the surface (a wall, canvas, or so on) behind the living mural. This can damage or break the weapon or surface.

6BA0nR5VEDa0Aw15.name: Surface-Bound
6BA0nR5VEDa0Aw15.description:
A living mural can move only along flat surfaces such as floors and walls. This allows it to end its movement wrapped around corners when on a continuous surface.

If the surface it's on is destroyed (such as a portrait hit by a fireball spell or a puddle being splashed), the mural takes [[/r {10d6}]]{10d6 damage} and is shunted to the nearest flat surface. If there is no flat surface within 5 feet, the living mural is destroyed.

6gBFZhqoL9eg2XDz.name: Collective Attack
6gBFZhqoL9eg2XDz.description:
The subjects depicted within the living mural all reach out at once to attack. The living mural makes a fist Strike against each target within range.

These attacks count toward the living mural's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of the attacks are made.

YE6DApvJToive72E.name: Paint the Masses
YE6DApvJToive72E.description:
The living mural expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] of paint.

Creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:41] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

The living mural can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

snJ95Lkh1TmrNndQ.name: Splash of Color
snJ95Lkh1TmrNndQ.description: When the living mural hits with a splatter attack, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

xkML6VHwHWx9E7rB.name: +2 Striking Staff
xkML6VHwHWx9E7rB.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

YMW42p6dKW5EgBSf.name: Disguise Kit (Elite)
YMW42p6dKW5EgBSf.description: This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. An elite disguise kit adds a +1 item bonus to relevant checks. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

AD2GrziGoOFfzrk7.name: Contingency Plan
AD2GrziGoOFfzrk7.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Kapral is targeted by an attack

Effect Kapral casts blink on herself.

1HjWqCIXUjmknlZE.name: Adamantine Strikes
1HjWqCIXUjmknlZE.description: Chaos Gulgamodh's body— including the appendages it uses to make melee Strikes—is made of adamantine.

268BBCle1rCc1g1d.name: Cannon Fusillade
268BBCle1rCc1g1d.description:
Chaos Gulgamodh unleashes a salvo of explosive blasts in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take [[/r (10d10+20)[fire]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true] save).

On a failed save, a creature is subjected to a @RollTable[cBHMpmeIhoBdUyQT]{Warpwave} effect. On a critically failed save, a creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Chaos Gulgamodh can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Burning Chandelier Trap.name: Agents of Edgewatch
Burning Chandelier Trap.description: Four large flaming chandeliers swing wildly around the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:36|name:Disable a Chandelier|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a chandelier or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 33) to permanently drain the magic from a chandelier. Any amount of cold damage that overcomes a chandelier's cold resistance extinguishes its flames and removes its persistent fire damage and flame dart attack. @Check[type:thievery|dc:41|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel in the southeast corner of the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no living creatures remaining in the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.hazardRoutine: (4 actions) For every chandelier disabled, the trap's actions are reduced by 1. For each of the trap's actions, a different chandelier attacks a random creature in the room. A chandelier uses its swinging chandelier attack if it can, but it can't make melee attacks against creatures in the cage, the closet, or the gap between the two double doors leading into the vault. Against a creature it can't reach with a melee attack, it uses a flame dart attack instead. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.

Veksciralenix.name: Veksciralenix
Veksciralenix.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

DrsLgW5tbXlYEqJ1.name: Alien Presence
DrsLgW5tbXlYEqJ1.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:90]{90 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that first enters the area must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:42] save.

Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the Veksciralenix's Alien Presence for 1 minute.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

ikVC2siqOrYTYZtS.name: Second Chance
ikVC2siqOrYTYZtS.description:
Frequency three times per day

Trigger Veksciralenix or a creature that Veksciralenix can see attempts a check and learns the results

Effect The triggering creature rerolls the triggering check and takes the second result.

CVTZnv3ZcE4LbDPg.name: Breath Weapon
CVTZnv3ZcE4LbDPg.description:
The time dragon breathes in one of two ways.

The dragon can't use again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Storm The dragon breathes a burst of lightning in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] that deals [[/r 20d6[electricity]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true|name:Storm Breath] save).

Time Displacement (arcane, transmutation) The dragon breathes a time storm. Each creature within a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42|name:Time Displacement Breath|traits:transmutation] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 6}.

UAnT1rt4pcCFs6br.name: Draconic Frenzy
UAnT1rt4pcCFs6br.description: Veksciralenix makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order.

r47iaCjc2jC8iNnL.name: Draconic Momentum
r47iaCjc2jC8iNnL.description: Veksciralenix recharges their Breath Weapon whenever they score a critical hit with a Strike.

hHlYjJTlmZGddvQY.name: Poisoner's Staff
hHlYjJTlmZGddvQY.description:
This gnarled staff is covered with thorns and coated with a glistening lacquer that acts as a minor irritant. While holding the staff, you aren't affected by its coating or thorns, and you reduce the DC of your flat checks to overcome persistent poison damage from 15 to 13.

Activate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell}

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

  • Cantrips @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs]{Guidance}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.QqxwHeYEVylkYjsO]{Detect Poison}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.DYdvMZ8G2LiSLVWw]{Spider Sting}

9HOzCgOAKeHP5EhB.name: Venom Explosion
9HOzCgOAKeHP5EhB.description:
Trigger The venom mage is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The venom mage explodes into a cloud of poison within a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]. The venom mage then reforms at a point they choose within the burst, avoids being knocked out, and remains at 1 Hit Point. The venom mage's wounded value increases by 1 when they use this ability, and they can't use this ability when they're wounded 3 or more. Creatures other than the venom mage within the burst must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success No effect.

Success The creature is sickened 1.

Failure The creature is sickened 2 and cannot recover from the sickened condition while within 20 feet of the venom mage.

Critical Failure As failure, but sickened 4.

wazlV57b7ZEUGjn6.name: Steady Spellcasting
wazlV57b7ZEUGjn6.description: If another creature's reaction would disrupt the venom mage's spellcasting action, the venom mage attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:15] check. If the venom mage succeeds, their action isn't disrupted.

Grabble Forden.name: Grabble Forden
Grabble Forden.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

53IhzCwi4y8yO9XX.name: Drain Bonded Item
53IhzCwi4y8yO9XX.description:
Frequency 7 times per day

Requirements Grabble hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect Grabble can cast one prepared spell he has already cast today without spending a spell slot. He must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements. He can do this once per day for each of the spell levels he can cast.

NILfejzFJ409TN4i.name: Poison Conversion
NILfejzFJ409TN4i.description:
Frequency 3 times per day

Effect If Grabble's next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is 6th level or lower and deals acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage, the spell deals poison damage rather than its normal damage type and gains the poison trait.

Franca Laurentz.name: Franca Laurentz
Franca Laurentz.npcAllSaves: +2 circumstance bonus to saves vs. poison

N7tigM3cgdlHJfqp.name: Shining Bolt
N7tigM3cgdlHJfqp.description: A piece of shining ammunition gives off a faint glow. When shot, this ammunition sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 10 minutes. If it hits a target, it sticks, causing the target to shed light in the same radius. A creature can remove the ammunition with an Interact action, but the ammunition itself continues to glow for the rest of the duration or until destroyed.

PzYFpkZAo1pAeUoo.description:
Activate2Interact

This oily, dark purple powder gives off the distinct odor of boiled leather. When delivered, the poison acts quickly to constrict the victim's blood flow to their extremities and turn their lungs into a soft jelly. A victim of blackfinger blight is recognizable by the pores of their fingertips weeping an inky oil that coats their hands and makes it difficult to hold things. Each round, at the beginning of their turn, a creature affected by blackfinger blight must succeed at a flat DC 5 check or drop one random item they're holding.

Saving Throw DC 32 Fortitude

Onset 1 round

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 6d6[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 8d6[poison]]] damage (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r 10d6[poison]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}(1 round)

XVBhNwitUtia7zY6.name: +2 Circumstance Bonus on Saves vs. Poison

LQEhpFQTxwqQ8b2q.name: Deflective Dodge
LQEhpFQTxwqQ8b2q.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Franca fails or critically fails

Effect Franca can choose to either Step or redirect the attack to a creature that is adjacent to her and within the reach of the triggering attack.

The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

udFVDwS0vDvYW3tw.name: Bloody Rebel
udFVDwS0vDvYW3tw.description:
Franca quickly slashes at nearby foes, aiming to maim rather than disable. She makes up to three melee Strikes, each against a different creature within reach.

These Strikes count toward Franca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all three Strikes are made.

On a hit, the Strike deals [[/r 3[bleed]]] damage instead of its normal damage.

On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the beginning of Franca's next turn or until they spend an action to remove the condition, whichever comes first.

oKdyZTnDb5xbqpF3.name: Hamstring
oKdyZTnDb5xbqpF3.description:
Requirements Franca's last action was a melee Strike that dealt sneak attack damage to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} target

Effect Franca deals [[/r 6[bleed]]] damage to the target creature, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

GrbNOULOdg2VBphU.description:
Franca's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

lVvJa2dDy1MeSjQ1.name: Splash Poison
lVvJa2dDy1MeSjQ1.description:
Franca uncorks and flings a dose of poison at a bleeding foe.

She retrieves a poison from her inventory, then splashes it at a creature within 10 feet that is currently taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32] save or be exposed to the poison.

Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).name: Agents of Edgewatch
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).description: A summoning circle inlaid into the room's floor detects living creatures and summons a violent devil.
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).hazardDisable: @Check[type:perception|dc:18|name:Notice the Trap's Magic|traits:action:seek] to notice the trap's magic and avoid stepping on the floor outside the circle, followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Break Summoning Circle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to break the circle or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 23) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).hazardReset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

pEr8VvYetu8yNn5t.name: Efficient Winding
pEr8VvYetu8yNn5t.description:
For the clockwork amalgam to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for 7 days, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again.

The amalgam can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt a @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Wind Down|traits:manipulate,action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device to wind the amalgam down. For each success, the assassin loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the amalgam is in standby mode.

eosKGTfGo3nA3EVl.name: Recalibrate
eosKGTfGo3nA3EVl.description: The clockwork amalgam can recalibrate its internal structure to shed damaged components and replace them with new ones, restoring 125 HP to the construct. Each time it uses this ability, the clockwork amalgam permanently deactivates one of its five melee attacks as the components from that arm reassemble within the core of the machine.

Wbny5fScmVtKCw6w.name: Whirring Doom
Wbny5fScmVtKCw6w.description:
Frequency once per round

The clockwork amalgam becomes a blur of spinning weaponry. It makes up to five melee Strikes (one for each active melee attack it has available), taking a -4 penalty to the attack roll for each attack, but ignoring the multiple attack penalty until it has made all of its attacks. It can use each melee attack only once and it can target each creature in reach only once. If the clockwork amalgam used Whirring Doom in the previous round, it can use it again this round using only 1 action instead of 3. The amalgam's movement Speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

2zo8BFj6mkav8MPT.name: Ferocious Devotion
2zo8BFj6mkav8MPT.description:
When an illusory toady is destroyed, it dissolves into a puddle of cerulean quintessence before reforming to quasi-life once more. One round after it is destroyed, the toady starts re-forming. One round after that, the toady is completely healed and begins to fight once more.

If damaged while it is re-forming but before the process is complete, the toady is destroyed but splits into two cerulean puddles that begin re-forming into two identical toadies 1 round later, each with half the maximum HP of the original toady (this is similar to an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.uQBOJfjtzEXvpLQz]{Ochre Jelly's} Split ability); the toadies begin re-forming 1 round later.

The toadies are permanently destroyed only by @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.ihbRf964JDXztcy3]{Disjunction} or if @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.agents-of-edgewatch-bestiary.sUrJ7jxzBiJTbwVo]{Blune} falls unconscious.

92BXBHbmRG68ifPd.name: Amplify Spell
92BXBHbmRG68ifPd.description:
The toady wills itself to become a conduit for Blune's next spell, empowering the spell.

The toady becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the beginning of its next turn.

If Blune Bandersworth is within 30 feet and Casts a Spell before the toady's next turn, the spell travels through the toady before redirecting toward its intended target.

The spell is heightened by 1 level, to a maximum of 10th level. The toady is then destroyed.

Supplicant Statues.name: Agents of Edgewatch
Supplicant Statues.description: Six statues rapidly slide around the room on rollers, slowing down intruders and striking at them with spring-loaded sword arms.
Supplicant Statues.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Statue Rollers|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a specific statue's rollers, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:39|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel in A4 deactivates the whole trap. For each statue disabled, the trap loses 1 action from its routine and the DC for its predictive impediment ability decreases by 4. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 32) doesn't harm the statues but removes the predictive impediment ability. Breaking the control panel prevents the trap from resetting.
Supplicant Statues.hazardReset: The trap deactivates and resets one minute after the room is empty.
Supplicant Statues.hazardRoutine: (6 actions) On the trap's initiative, each functioning statue slides up to 40 feet around the room and makes a statue shortsword Strike against an adjacent creature. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty, and the statues' movements don't trigger reactions.

bKDnotLHOqr113Bf.description: This ring magically conceals any armor and sheathed weapons you're wearing by either turning them invisible or creating the illusion of ordinary clothes. The ring doesn't change your appearance beyond concealing weapons and armor. As soon as you wield a weapon, the weapon becomes obvious to onlookers and is no longer affected by the ring until you sheathe the weapon for at least 1 minute. A creature can disbelieve this illusion by Seeking or any time it hits you with an attack.

aBQGxKqOuBqF1FkF.name: Double Stab
aBQGxKqOuBqF1FkF.description:
Requirements Ralso is wielding two piercing weapons

Frequency once per round

Effect Ralso makes two Strikes against a single creature within reach, one Strike per weapon.

These attacks count toward Ralso's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

VsMHrDx86310JmtX.description:
Ralso deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

NOvbOqZ37Tq8TaMA.description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, [[/r 2d6[persistent,acid]]] damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

b45B3Ns6mwEya56I.description:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 2d8 fire damage, [[/r 2[persistent,fire]]] damage, and 2 fire splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

FnOoWUqsRQWlwgHs.description: This mobile collection of vials and chemicals can be used for simple alchemical tasks.

f6aAjLfElEhbsLCC.name: Dirty Bomb
f6aAjLfElEhbsLCC.description:
Requirements The chemist has at least one bomb in their possession

Effect The chemist adds a hasty mix of noxious substances to the bomb and makes a ranged Strike with it. If it hits and deals damage, the target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}; if the result of the save is a critical failure, this increases to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. For the next 24 hours, the affected target takes a -2 circumstance penalty (-3 on a critical failure) to additional Fortitude saving throws against the same chemist's Crude Bombs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.5ZK22sNW7o26aST0]{Effect: Dirty Bomb}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.ryY6fdqpC5Ztnagd]{Effect: Dirty Bomb (Critical Failure)}

2FxUvyDjnESqE9bl.name: Quick Brew
2FxUvyDjnESqE9bl.description:
Requirements The chemist has their alchemist's tools, formula book, and a free hand

Effect The chemist creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Moderate Acid Flask} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire} that they must use before the end of their next turn or else it becomes inert.

Water Elemental Vessel (I2).name: Water Elemental Vessel (I2)
Water Elemental Vessel (I2).description: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

N85UwJsuAe8nwuWV.name: Spell Circle
N85UwJsuAe8nwuWV.description: By performing an hour-long ritual, an elemental vessel can form a spell circle with an arcane or primal spellcaster. After the spell circle is formed, other spellcasters can join the spell circle by performing the same hour-long ritual while assisted by at least one spellcaster already in the spell circle. Each member of the spell circle must contribute at least one spell to the elemental vessel. The spellcaster permanently loses access to a spell slot equal to the spell's level and the elemental vessel adds the contributed spell to its list of arcane innate spells (regardless of the spell's original type). An elemental vessel can be imbued with no more than three spells per spell level. If the elemental vessel is destroyed, all members of the spell circle regain the spell slots they contributed to the creature. The arcane innate spells shown below represent a typical spell list for an elemental vessel, but each elemental vessel is likely to have different spells depending on what its spell circle has contributed.

fgprZ9vs1zfRUz3o.name: Dispel Vulnerability
fgprZ9vs1zfRUz3o.description: Whenever a creature successfully counteracts one of its spells, the vessel permanently loses access to that spell and takes damage equal to 4 × the spell's level. The spell circle member who contributed that spell regains access to their contributed spell slot.

jJSKOhaRoCp1WwP4.name: Inhabit Vessel
jJSKOhaRoCp1WwP4.description: Any member of the elemental vessel's spell circle can spend 3 actions to mentally inhabit the vessel for 1 round. While they inhabit the vessel, the inhabiter controls the vessel's actions, and the vessel uses the inhabiter's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma modifiers for all checks. Only one creature can inhabit an elemental vessel at a time.

g8bRqHNpfEqsTYyx.name: Internal Spell Strike
g8bRqHNpfEqsTYyx.description: The elemental vessel targets an engulfed creature with one of its spells. The spell must have a range of touch.

s3e8tlqX6GRkply1.name: +1 Striking Morningstar
s3e8tlqX6GRkply1.description: This weapon has a short shaft ending in a metal ball studded with spikes.

htoPdmfkuLgCEqQP.name: Breastplate
htoPdmfkuLgCEqQP.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half-plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

7RZClAttcFohXVTd.name: Little Favors
7RZClAttcFohXVTd.description: Each time a creature willingly performs a service, quest, or task for the zealborn, the creature takes a cumulative -1 status penalty to saving throws against the zealborn's mental spells and abilities (maximum -4).

5izc2RKfDYtjIicX.name: Rejuvenation
5izc2RKfDYtjIicX.description: When a zealborn is destroyed, it re-forms, fully healed, near a follower of its choice in [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}. For the purposes of rejuvenation, a follower is defined as an intelligent creature who's well acquainted with the zealborn and is a true believer in the zealborn's mission, not merely a lukewarm supporter. A zealborn can be permanently destroyed only if they have no current followers or can be convinced to end their own life.

EbIhMOd0cHtkhNcM.name: Zealous Restoration
EbIhMOd0cHtkhNcM.description: A zealborn can't regain Hit Points through resting or negative healing; they feed only on the idealism of their supporters, regaining 10 Hit Points per day for each creature under the effects of a geas cast by the zealborn. Creatures under a zealborn's geas have their maximum HP reduced by 10 each day until they are burned away to a husk and perish. After 24 hours, such creatures rise as zeal-damned ghouls under the zealborn's control. Zeal-damned ghouls eat only the flesh of evil or chaotic creatures and deal an additional 1d6 chaotic and 1d6 negative damage with their attacks.

Vy9EtFybJQqo55xn.name: Hypnotic Glow
Vy9EtFybJQqo55xn.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Similar to other will-o'-wisps, a gloaming will-o'-wisp is naturally invisible, but glows with a faint colored light. They cast dim light in the aura, which makes them visible. In addition, any non-aberration creature that ends their turn in the aura and can see the gloaming will-o'-wisp is distracted by the gloaming will-o'-wisp's glow and must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:31] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and takes [[/r 3d6[mental]]] damage.

yAHJOd3dkfOae1Kf.name: Magic Immunity
yAHJOd3dkfOae1Kf.description: A will-o'-wisp is immune to all spells except faerie fire, glitterdust, magic missile, and maze.

Yb2OjQReLk3HgLoc.name: Feed on Fear
Yb2OjQReLk3HgLoc.description:
Requirement An enemy is under a fear effect or dying within 15 feet of the will-o'-wisp

Effect The will-o'-wisp feeds on the creature's terror. They regains 4d8 Hit Points, and if they've Gone Dark, their glow reignites. A will-o'-wisp can take this action only once per round.

T4zHj7DFiaCBwf6f.name: Go Dark
T4zHj7DFiaCBwf6f.description: The gloaming will-o'-wisp extinguishes their hypnotic glow, becoming invisible. They can end this effect with another use of this action. If they use their shock attack while invisible, the arc of electricity lets any observer determine their location, making the will-o'-wisp only hidden to observers until they move.

6u1eMdIQZV0dWPQU.name: Opportune Dodge
6u1eMdIQZV0dWPQU.description:
Trigger A creature critically fails a Strike against the Daemonic Rumormonger

Effect The Rumormonger dodges out of the way and uses his momentum to attack and move out of reach. He Strides up to 20 feet and can Strike at any point during this movement; this Strike counts toward the multiple attack penalty on his next turn.

qFILNq2kmX5xF0Dt.name: Black Ink Delirium
qFILNq2kmX5xF0Dt.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r 3d6[poison]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r 6d6[poison]]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 round)

a5d4jfdl2s8CiAsa.name: Breath of Lies
a5d4jfdl2s8CiAsa.description:
The Daemonic Rumormonger breathes a torrent of acidic sand and poisoned ink in an @Template[type:line|distance:80], dealing [[/r 6d12[acid]]] damage and [[/r 6d12[poison]]] damage and exposing victims to his black ink delirium.

He can't use Breath of Lies again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

rZ6LtOq5W7Ef8R1W.name: Whirling Slashes
rZ6LtOq5W7Ef8R1W.description: The Daemonic Rumormonger Strides up to his Speed. He can make up to three claw Strikes, each against a different target, at any points during this Stride. His multiple attack penalty applies as usual.

0DxZM2ZhwpKrUolW.description:
The Copper Hand illusionist deals 2d6 additional precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

The Winder.name: Agents of Edgewatch
The Winder.description: A large metallic arm, 20 feet long, is set into the floor. It rotates around the room to wind up nearby clockwork creatures.
The Winder.hazardDisable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:50|name:Deactivate System|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to deactivate the system, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:40|name:Jam Gears] (legendary) to jam the gears for 1 round
The Winder.hazardReset: The Winder resets as soon as no creatures remain in the room.
The Winder.hazardRoutine: (1, 2, or 4 actions, depending on the encounter's threat level) The Winder uses each of its actions to Wind clockwork assassins in the room, starting with inactive ones.

Hestriviniaas.name: Hestriviniaas
Hestriviniaas.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

4Wo8cEyKXFYXahnb.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 60 feet
4Wo8cEyKXFYXahnb.description:
Hestriviniaas can anticipate the most likely presence of a creature through a supernatural insight into chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants it the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection} or that is otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions cannot be noticed via entropy sense.

wKQPyzZESm0w8vni.name: Protean Anatomy
wKQPyzZESm0w8vni.description:
Hestriviniaas' vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the Hestriviniaas takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type.

This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The keketar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target.

If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the keketar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

79KeB3EaNuz3Wjd2.name: Spatial Riptide
79KeB3EaNuz3Wjd2.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature using a teleportation ability within the aura or arriving in it via teleportation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45] save or wink out of existence for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} before completing the teleport. The creature can't act, sense anything, or be targeted. On a successful save, the creature completes the teleport normally but is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Keketars are immune to this effect.

nO9dKSqf8ZjJRuCy.description:
Hestriviniaas can take the appearance of any Gargantuan or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

0tqsvUhGYvPuB2ga.name: Reshape Reality
0tqsvUhGYvPuB2ga.description: When Hestriviniaas casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

laNWVOBt5DoTHn3G.name: Warpwave Strike
laNWVOBt5DoTHn3G.description: A creature struck by Hestriviniaas' jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45|traits:polmorph] save or be subject to a @RollTable[cBHMpmeIhoBdUyQT]{Warpwave}.

Explosive Barrels.name: Agents of Edgewatch
Explosive Barrels.description: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.
Explosive Barrels.hazardDisable: @Check[type:survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels

tF3OooF3TgShCxrF.name: +1 Striking Composite Shortbow
tF3OooF3TgShCxrF.description: This shortbow is made from horn, wood, and sinew laminated together to increase the power of its pull and the force of its projectile. Its compact size and power make it a favorite of mounted archers. Any time an ability is specifically restricted to a shortbow, it also applies to composite shortbows unless otherwise stated.

xZ3ieTwpHIr5Ysgl.name: +1 Leather Armor
xZ3ieTwpHIr5Ysgl.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

b7d4FMN2Fj0m71FK.name: Religious Symbol (norgorber)
b7d4FMN2Fj0m71FK.description: This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

hwPxq98MdBLlWfAG.name: Arrows With Shadow Essence
hwPxq98MdBLlWfAG.description:
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

Infused with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Wjkw0lEUOhypYvzo]{Shadow Essence}

ykHarPFAY9t176Uv.name: Attack of Opportunity
ykHarPFAY9t176Uv.description:
Trigger A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.

Effect The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

iYdGVR75KvoZWFO3.name: Toxic Mastery
iYdGVR75KvoZWFO3.description: Kalyn can masterfully manipulate vile, poisonous energy and increase its potency. Her melee and ranged Strikes deal an additional 2d6 poison damage, and a target that takes this poison damage has a -1 status penalty to saving throws against Kalyn's divine spells for 1 round. Poisons delivered by Kalyn have the virulent trait.

Ixusoth.name: Ixusoth
Ixusoth.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

ZfiEVipzehZo1cei.name: Robe of Eyes
ZfiEVipzehZo1cei.description:
This garment appears to be an ordinary robe until donned, at which point numerous strange and alien eyes of varied shapes and colors open and blink across its fabric. While wearing the robe, you gain a +3 item bonus to Perception checks, and you constantly benefit from the effects of a 2nd-level see @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility} spell.

You can also see powerful magic auras. The highest-level magic aura within 30 feet of you glows in a color that reveals its school to you and allows you to determine where the effect originates. This can narrow down the origin point of the effect to a 5-foot-cube, but not more precisely than that.

The robe of eyes is not without its dangers. If any spell with the light trait is cast on you or your square while you are wearing the robe, you are blinded for a number of rounds equal to the spell's level unless you succeed at a Fortitude save against the spell's DC.

Activate A Interact

Effect You pluck an eye from the robe and toss it into the air, where it turns invisible and floats to a destination you choose, with the same effect as a 5th-level @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Ek5XI0aEdZhBgm21]{Prying Eye} spell. You can Sustain the Activation just as you would be able to Sustain the Spell.

rY3uWiPQqOCSmYTu.name: Lore Master
rY3uWiPQqOCSmYTu.description: Ixusoth retains a vast amount of knowledge. She can use her Bardic Lore skill to Recall Knowledge on any topic, and she knows any languages common to an area she has spent a day or more in.

niqal0ySwUPyqG0P.name: Eye Probe
niqal0ySwUPyqG0P.description:
Frequency once per day

Up to six of Ixusoth's eyes detach from her body. Each eye has AC 26, HP 1, and a fly speed of 40 feet. Ixusoth can see through all of her eye probes. She can move the probes all in separate directions using a single action. Ixusoth can have no more than six eye probes active at a time; using this ability to create more eyes causes the eye or eyes farthest away to shrivel and die.

Ixusoth can deliver touch spells through her eye probes and make melee spell attacks through them. In addition, she can Steal Memories through an eye probe using a single action by touching the target with the eye.

QURekRpCFthbGcMS.name: Scatterbrain Palm
QURekRpCFthbGcMS.description:
A creature hit by Ixusoth's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:36] save. The creature is then temporarily immune until the start of its next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is stunned 1.

Failure The creature is stunned 2.

Critical Failure The creature is stunned 3, and the hyakume can use Steal Memories on the target as part of this action.

8j0TGPf1kZlcIwpn.name: Steal Memories
8j0TGPf1kZlcIwpn.description: Ixusoth reaches out with her mind and attempts to steal memories from a creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:40] saving throw or become stupefied 2 and have some of its memories stolen. When Ixusoth steals memories, she learns some of the creature's memories (chosen by the GM). These memories are then lost to that creature.

GNoQny8KdUr88SvA.description: This type of armor is chain mail reinforced with flexible, interlocking metal plates, typically located on the wearer's torso, upper arms, and legs. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of padded armor (see above) and a pair of gauntlets.

Carvey.name: Carvey
Carvey.description: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life. Though it has no mind, it can still go into a berserk rage when harmed, giving it a faint semblance of emotion. Flesh golems guard the laboratories and charnel houses of fleshwarpers and necromancers who feel no compunctions about desecrating corpses for their own ends. Though the first flesh golem is believed to have been a misguided attempt to create from simple base elements, these monstrosities are far from human. In isolated cases, echoes of a personality might rise in a flesh golem if the brain used as part of its construction belonged to a particularly powerful personality, but such tragic instances are rare in the extreme.

X7yV3UIdROaskajA.name: Suicidal Obedience
X7yV3UIdROaskajA.description:
Carvey is unerringly loyal to the Skinsaw cult and to Mobana especially. When Carvey goes berserk, she doesn't attack the nearest living creature or object but instead moves adjacent to the creature nearest the balcony (or similar falling hazard, if the battle is taking place elsewhere) and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the creature over the cliff's edge.

The number of feet Carvey can Shove a creature is doubled as long as Carvey has 40 or fewer HP (thus, she pushes a creature 10 feet on a sucessful check and 20 feet on a critical success), but she must move the same distance and in the same direction as the pushed creature.

If the shoved creature falls over the cliff's edge, so does Carvey.

95kvqPPSJNio8vAK.name: Berserk
95kvqPPSJNio8vAK.description:
A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk.

If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

Hss992fc1sCOcDVo.name: Electric Reflexes
Hss992fc1sCOcDVo.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} an adjacent creature. The creature also takes [[/r 3d6[electricity]]] damage on a success, or [[/r 6d6[electricity]]] damage on a critical success.

Q4P1CH4AQAlYpZ0X.name: Golem Antimagic
Q4P1CH4AQAlYpZ0X.description:
harmed by fire ([[/r 5d8]], [[/r 3d4]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area [[/r 2d4[healing]]]{2d4 Hit Points}); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

uzwUjI3gD8tO8Chh.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
uzwUjI3gD8tO8Chh.description: Casting a flesh to stone spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

hvTnI184eIoLfwPq.name: Berserk Slam
hvTnI184eIoLfwPq.description:
Requirement The flesh golem is berserk.

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals [[/r 1d6]] extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Sordesdaemon.name: Sordesdaemon
Sordesdaemon.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

8QnTTWcdqDNyOtIl.name: Miasma of Pollution
8QnTTWcdqDNyOtIl.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures in the aura can't reduce the value of the sickened condition.

A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn in it must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:34] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it is sickened on a critical failure).

A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Creatures made of water (such as water elementals) and plant creatures use an outcome one degree of success worse than the result of their save.

ztgpLrKdJjctex5J.name: Pollution Infusion
ztgpLrKdJjctex5J.description:
Non-fiend creatures adjacent to the afflicted creature take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws against disease

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} (1 week)

Stage 5 dead.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.gORyINQLvplfthlm]{Effect: Pollution Infusion}

wW8lBy7vi5CcDHTN.name: Retch of Foulness
wW8lBy7vi5CcDHTN.description:
The sordesdaemon exhales a spray of sewage that deals [[/r 8d6[acid]]] damage and [[/r 8d6[poison]]] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|basic:true] save).

It can't use Retch of Foulness again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue
Prospecti Statue.description: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.name: Construct Armor
FHYZijWKqxyPWq4b.description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.name: Stone Robes
M203mlcBNFvAqyIJ.description:
The Prospecti statue turns suddenly, causing its robes, which flow like fabric despite being as hard as stone, to swing about and damage opponents.

Creatures adjacent to the animated statue take [[/r (2d6+6)[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save); on a critical failure, the creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone})

Tiderunner Aquamancer.name: Tiderunner Aquamancer
Tiderunner Aquamancer.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. enchantments, -2 to all saves vs. aboleth effects

dDbS7aNivWy3A1QB.name: +2 Striking Spear
dDbS7aNivWy3A1QB.description: A long metal shaft ending with a metal spike, a spear can be used one-handed as a melee weapon and can be thrown.

22ts3ClOQFeLq0Jt.name: Water Shield
22ts3ClOQFeLq0Jt.description: The aquamancer is surrounded by a bubble of water that buffers attacks. Each round, the shield absorbs the first 25 damage that would be dealt to the aquamancer. The shield can absorb only bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, acid, cold, and fire damage types. The aquamancer can dismiss or raise their shield by spending a single action.

igIwGgzOBvjtlLdx.name: Transparent
igIwGgzOBvjtlLdx.description:
A slithering rift is so clear that it's difficult to spot. A successful @Check[type:perception|dc:48] check is required to notice a stationary slithering rift, and a creature must be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching} to attempt this check.

A creature that walks into the rift's space might fall into any pit currently in effect due to Dimensional Pit.

nyahaCV93O7YYyau.name: Breach Vulnerability
nyahaCV93O7YYyau.description:
Ingesting an extradimensional space like that found in a bag of holding deals [[/r 12d8[force]]] damage to the slithering rift and its occupants.

The slithering rift then immediately uses Out You Go.

M7E6dxLskMLaX43G.name: Dimensional Pit
M7E6dxLskMLaX43G.description:
The slithering rift opens an extradimensional, 20-foot-deep pit that covers its own space and all adjacent squares unless they are walls or similarly blocking terrain.

Any other creature occupying spaces in the pit must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save or fall into the pit, taking damage from the fall (typically [[/r 10[bludgeoning]]] damage). Any creature grabbed by the ooze is released from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.i18TlebMzwONyPhI]{Grab} and falls in, even if it was outside the pit squares.

While the pit is open, the slithering rift is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and can't be forced to move. It can make pseudopod Strikes originating from the walls of the pit. A creature that starts its turn at the bottom of the pit takes [[/r 5d6[acid]]] damage.

Creatures can climb the walls with a @Check[type:athletics|dc:40|name:Climb Out of the Rift|traits:action:climb] check. When the slithering rift dies, the pit closes and creatures inside are ejected, as Out you Go.

zvkxJ9ZreNjX3yJL.name: Flurry of Pods
zvkxJ9ZreNjX3yJL.description:
The slithering rift makes a single pseudopod Strike against each target within range it hasn't already @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

These attacks count toward the slithering rift's multiple attack penalty, but this penalty doesn't increase until after all of these attacks.

IH1SiADzFCDakX8w.name: Out You Go
IH1SiADzFCDakX8w.description:
The slithering rift closes all pit spaces it created using Dimensional Pit, ejecting all its occupants onto the ground into random free spaces where the opening of the pit was.

Each occupant takes [[/r 9d6[bludgeoning]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true] save).

glyWTuwYyEk8AaC1.name: Dubious Shifting
glyWTuwYyEk8AaC1.description:
The zrukbat assumes the shape of any Small object or ornamentation, although the zrukbat's mimicked objects usually have unrealistic or suspicious quirks.

This doesn't change the zrukbat's size but can alter their coloration and visual appearance.

They have an automatic result of 23 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the mimicked object.

ekdPtlR0pjDVDM4T.name: Go for the Eyes
ekdPtlR0pjDVDM4T.description:
The zrukbat flies up to its Speed and makes a claw Strike at the end of its move.

If the claw attack hits, the target must succeed on a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or blinded for 1 minute on a critical failure). If the Strike was a critical hit, the target's save result is one degree of success worse.

9hvKp9EJbq6Log0q.name: Consume Flesh
9hvKp9EJbq6Log0q.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of an evil or chaotic creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 6d6]] Hit Points. It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

j72OO3UZ0KrTLLO6.name: Ghoul Fever
j72OO3UZ0KrTLLO6.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r 2d6[negative]]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a zeal-damned ghoul the next midnight.

QSKXWJ8br4qwHbtf.name: Paralysis
QSKXWJ8br4qwHbtf.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

PJdaCe5La2FhB5AN.name: Swift Leap
PJdaCe5La2FhB5AN.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).name: Agents of Edgewatch
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).description: An invisible cloud of magical sensors detects living creatures in the room and summons fire elementals to slay the creatures.
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).hazardDisable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:22|name:Approach Rune] (trained) to approach without triggering the trap, followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Erase Summoning Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the rune or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).hazardReset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Izfiitar.name: Izfiitar
Izfiitar.npcAllSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

aJI86W6ShmBc7gPN.name: Entropy Sense (Imprecise) 120 feet
aJI86W6ShmBc7gPN.description:
A Izfiitar can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the izflitar the ability to sense creatures within the listed range.

The izflitar's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.EoKBlgf6Smt8opaU]{Nondetection} or that are otherwise shielded from divinations and predictions.

JXIun04dusvrOS6n.name: Kiss of the Speakers
JXIun04dusvrOS6n.description:
The izfiitar continuously tinkers with the myriad possibilities in which it can move or manipulate magic.

The izfiitar is always @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} and can use the extra action only to Cast a Spell, Step, or Stride.

o03yd3s67EeP9WOh.name: Prescient Revision
o03yd3s67EeP9WOh.description:
Trigger The izfiitar fails a check

Effect The izfiitar rerolls the triggering check and takes the better result.

For [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, it loses the effects of Kiss of the Speakers and can't use Reshape Reality.

UOmYO7g7ej3NwdzH.name: Protean Anatomy 25
UOmYO7g7ej3NwdzH.description:
A izfiitar's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the izfiitar takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

The izfiitar is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the izfiitar automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

9m6cGcYmQptppNHf.description:
The izfiitar takes the appearance of any Huge or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

8xAxPvW0rww5NovC.name: Greater Warpwave Strike
8xAxPvW0rww5NovC.description:
Any creature struck and damaged by an izfiitar's jaws or claw Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:42] save or be subject to a particularly powerful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.rollable-tables.yRZwPolTnRdnz42V]{Warpwave}.

Roll twice and apply both affects, rerolling any duplicates.

BsQZslLQ0FJcYne3.name: Reshape Reality
BsQZslLQ0FJcYne3.description: When the izfiitar casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.HBJPsonQnWcC3qdX]{Hallucinatory Terrain}, it infuses the illusion with quasi-real substance. Creatures that do not disbelieve the illusion treat structures and terrain created through the spell as though they were real, ascending illusory stairs, becoming trapped by illusory quicksand, and so on.

XEmgx6gs9UBM9Fqd.name: Storm of Claws
XEmgx6gs9UBM9Fqd.description: The izfiitar makes up to six claw Strikes, each against a different target.

0tydSelE4MWNlyip.name: Project Image (At Will) (See Project False Image)

Ctkj7r3YYAFSQEKx.name: Disgorge Portal
Ctkj7r3YYAFSQEKx.description:
The camarach vomits a spray of coruscating light. This has the effect of a DC 42 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.d6o52BnjViNz7Gub]{Prismatic Spray}, except that each creature is affected by one violet beam and one other beam (roll 1d6 instead of 1d8 to determine which other beam).

The camarach can't Disgorge a Portal again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

wjucZTZEvK64kwlz.name: Exile
wjucZTZEvK64kwlz.description:
The camarach shunts one creature within its body through an inner portal to send it away.

The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:38] save.

Critical Success The creature is teleported to an open space it chooses within 30 feet of the camarach.

Success The creature isn't teleported.

Failure The creature is teleported to a random open space 1 mile from the camarach.

Critical Failure The creature is teleported to a random other plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Plane Shift}.

LvmDMsbTpm0IyK9u.name: Fast Swallow
LvmDMsbTpm0IyK9u.description:
Trigger The camarach Grabs a creature

Effect The camarach uses Swallow Whole.

nurJkCpZvHiPZo76.name: Project False Image
nurJkCpZvHiPZo76.description: When the camarach casts project image, its illusory image can be another creature of its size or a structure of its size that features a large portal (such as a freestanding archway or a large hut with an open doorway).

9ShSRecAk97rJkLS.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
9ShSRecAk97rJkLS.description: Tyrroicese can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

GnvMkeIBg6ZpYXzJ.name: Pseudopod Burst
GnvMkeIBg6ZpYXzJ.description:
Tyrroicese makes up to three pseudopod strikes, each against a different creature.

Tyrroicese's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all these attacks are made.

haax0MkiNqA6MN2L.name: Rallying Call
haax0MkiNqA6MN2L.description:
When Tyrroicese subsumed Corporal Quordein, it gained a perverted form of the commander's ability to rally allies.

The first time Tyrroicese uses this ability, it summons an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.uQBOJfjtzEXvpLQz]{Ochre Jelly}, which leaks out of the ceiling of area D13 and drops to the floor to join the fight, siding with Tyrroicese.

Thereafter, when Tyrroicese uses this ability, any oozes within 60 feet become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round (the oozes can use their extra action only to Stride) and, if they're not allied with the agents, the oozes ally themselves with Tyrroicese.

RQ0R47s8yyK8gYS8.name: Stretching Step
RQ0R47s8yyK8gYS8.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Tyrroicese forcefully extends a sticky pseudopod, plants it on a wall within 45 feet, and retracts the muscle.

Tyrroicese springs over to a space adjacent to the wall, moving through the intervening squares as normal but ignoring any difficult or greater difficult terrain.

bi6VcgRWUdub6hl4.name: Subsume
bi6VcgRWUdub6hl4.description:
Tyrroicese lifts an adjacent dying creature with its pseudopods and subsumes that creature into its own oozy flesh. The subsumed creature's dying value does not increase, though it can't decrease either.

Tyrroicese regains 30 HP and also gains the ability to use one or two of the subsumed creature's special abilities or feats, subject to the GM's discretion.

A creature adjacent to Tyrroicese can extract a subsumed creature by spending 2 actions to attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:29|name:Extract Subsumed Creature] check.

On a success, the subsumed creature is pulled from Tyrroicese and falls into the nearest available space.

kEiDcm42Prsww2ja.name: Alchemical Reaction
kEiDcm42Prsww2ja.description:
Trigger The alchemical horror takes damage from an alchemical bomb

Effect The volatile substances that compose the alchemical horror froth outward as they react with the bomb. The bomb's full effects affect creatures in every space within 15 feet of the alchemical horror, and splash damage affects creatures 5 feet beyond that.

F0wNdQAwukZzTRRS.name: Alchemical Torrent
F0wNdQAwukZzTRRS.description:
The alchemical horror spews a torrent of alchemical fluids in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] that deals [[/r 20d6[acid]]] damage to creatures in the area (@Check[type:reflex|dc:43|basic:true] save).

The alchemical horror can't use this ability again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Nenchuuj.name: Nenchuuj
Nenchuuj.npcAllSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

2wSPUQgCOkfTQCUJ.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

LBQk96wXoxYrTUZi.name: Distort Magic
LBQk96wXoxYrTUZi.description:
Trigger A creature targets the nenchuuj with a spell

Effect The nenchuuj warps the creature's magic, attempting an Arcana check to counteract the spell. If successful, the nenchuuj can instead redirect the spell, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.OOELvfkTedBMlWtq]{Spell Turning}, onto the caster or onto a different target within range from the caster.

bZAhdsbYFuZ2syFl.name: Easy to Call
bZAhdsbYFuZ2syFl.description: The sahkil is considered 2 levels lower for the purposes of being summoned by rituals (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.2ykmAVKrsAWcazcC]{Planar Binding}), but is always free to attack or leave instead of negotiate unless the primary caster's check is a critical success.

LvYtP53GFOEynRGV.name: Skip Between
LvYtP53GFOEynRGV.description: The sahkil can move itself between the Ethereal Plane and the Material Plane, as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.D2nPKbIS67m9199U]{Ethereal Jaunt}, except that this ability has an unlimited duration and can be Dismissed.

Hq1vagZwNS6eDSNA.name: Tainted Backlash
Hq1vagZwNS6eDSNA.description:
A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} by the sahkil's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.O6VQC1Bs4aSYDa6R]{Mask of Terror} is gripped with fear of the ways magic can go wrong.

The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for as long as it is frightened. If the creature Casts a Spell during its turn, it can't reduce its frightened condition at the end of that turn.

TfGlX9oclwIPR62r.name: Toxin-Inured
TfGlX9oclwIPR62r.description: A poison eater can't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition from poisons.

RiF9Uw43dbvL8TEa.name: Consume Poison
RiF9Uw43dbvL8TEa.description:
The poison eater uses an Interact action to draw a dose of poison and eats it, gaining strength.

The poison-eater's Strikes deal two weapon dice of damage rather than one. The poison eater is affected by the consumed poison normally and, therefore, usually chooses poisons mitigated by their poison resistance and toxin-inured ability.

At the end of each of their turns, the poison eater attempts a @Check[type:flat|dc:17|name:Consumed Poison Metabolizes] check; on a success, this ability ends.

C8jCG9WTW2fP6H0b.name: Poison Frenzy
C8jCG9WTW2fP6H0b.description:
Requirements The poison eater isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or already in a frenzy

Trigger the poison eater damages a creature while Consume Poison is in effect

Effect The poison eater flies into a frenzy that lasts for 1 minute. While in a frenzy, the poison eater gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with melee Strikes, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with melee Strikes, gains 20 temporary Hit Points until the end of the frenzy, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. The poison eater can't voluntarily end their frenzy. After their frenzy, the poison eater is fatigued.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.u2z1BgpZsxl7Zc2z]{Effect: Poison Frenzy}

OfYcuvZbwxbjF6cG.name: Vein Walker
OfYcuvZbwxbjF6cG.description: The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground. An excorion cannot be Tripped, Shoved, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).

qCVeUkgwYXq7lu8z.name: Bloody Handprint
qCVeUkgwYXq7lu8z.description: The excorion plants a magical handprint on the target, marking them as chosen for death. The excorion makes a fist Strike against an adjacent creature; this does not count toward the excorion's multiple attack penalty. On a hit, the attack does no damage, but the creature becomes observed to every excorion within 60 feet, even if an excorion's line of sight would be blocked by a wall or other obstacle. This effect lasts until the handprint is washed off, which requires water and spending 3 actions to fully clean off.

yTV624ydUotNS7Qa.name: Vital Transfusion
yTV624ydUotNS7Qa.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 70 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy; the living creature also counts as an excorion for 1 minute for the purpose of seeing other excorions' Bloody Handprint marks.

MIGvbijvRTovVpJE.name: Vomit Blood
MIGvbijvRTovVpJE.description: The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has grabbed. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Miogimo.name: Miogimo
Miogimo.npcAllSaves: +1 status bonus to Will saves vs. mental effects

5qAf1qV6aq6q3pQl.name: Little Favors
5qAf1qV6aq6q3pQl.description: Each time a creature willingly performs a service, quest, or task for the zealborn, the creature takes a cumulative -1 status penalty to saving throws against the zealborn's mental spells and abilities (maximum -4).

CcCVlFjqLYk2DTlc.name: +1 Status to Will Saves vs. Mental

7kep2BZKcI8m29QV.name: Rejuvenation
7kep2BZKcI8m29QV.description: When Miogimo is destroyed, he re-forms, fully healed, near a follower of his choice in [[/br 1d10 #Rejuvenation]]{1d10 days}. For the purposes of rejuvenation, a follower is defined as an intelligent creature who's well acquainted with Miogimo and is a true believer in Miogimo's mission, not merely a lukewarm supporter. Miogimo can be permanently destroyed only if he has no current followers or can be convinced to end his own life.

mNgkZuWHNH6FJsSb.name: Trickster's Ace
mNgkZuWHNH6FJsSb.description:
Trigger An effect would cause Miogimo to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or would slow his movement

Effect Miogimo casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Freedom of Movement} on himself.
